history.content: AFAIK everyone gets into 61A  so don't worry about being on the waitlist, it will eventually expand to accommodate everyone.

I am currently 3rd on the wait list for CS61A. I am and Econ major hoping to minor in data science and need to complete my lower division CS requirement. CS 88 is now open for enrollment , however the section is still not assigned a room. The schedule planner says there are 157 open seats in the lecture and section as of today.

My question is: is it safe to drop 61A and attempt to add CS88? I am scared because it wasn't allowing me to enroll in 88 last time I tried to register at the start of enrollment (because there was no instructor or room assigned). Because I cannot swap a wait listed class, I would hate to drop 61A, lose my spot on the wait list, only to face enrollment issues with 88. Has anyone had any problems enrolling in CS88 since it opened?

Any advice is greatly appreciated. (Hopefully quick since Phase 1 ends today! oops)
history.subject: Is it safe to drop 61A to add CS88?
